CatDescriptText: Mr. Hardin Lyles, unemployed steelworker, 822 Pennsylvania Avenue, Coraopolis, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "We follow the church leadership the most, and we have done it for years and years.  We should continue to do it.  And the reason why is that everything springs from the church and this includes the leadership of politics and labor."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harlin Lyles wearing dark corduroy button down jacket and hat, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Builiding with Thrift Drugs store in background, Downtown
